newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Bank Negara S'pore branch FRCD raised to US$50 mln.
newsitem.headline: Bank Negara S'pore branch FRCD raised to US$50 mln.

text.p: Bank Negara Indonesia Singapore branch's three-year floating rate certificates of deposit issue has been increased to US$50 million from US$30 million due to oversubscription, arranger Overseas Union Bank Singapore branch said on Friday.
The certificates were issued at par to float at 40 basis points over the three- or six-month London Interbank Offered Rate.
With fees, the all-in return for top-tier managers is 52.5 basis points.
Co-arrangers are JP Morgan Securities Asia and Sanwa International Finance.
Twelve banks joined the syndication in addition to the arranger and co-arrangers, OUB Singapore said.
Signing is set for December 18 in Singapore.
